Če nebi Gadafija likvidirali, bi mogoče on banko dokapitaliziral.
Vidi pa se strah, da bi lahko"nevtralna" Švica blokirala premoženje
kaki ne nevtralni državi v primeru političnih pretresov. Tako
da...dvigni nenar in beži, dokler je še čas
Ne vem če je fora v tem.
CS je sistemska banka in takšni ne živijo od depozitov, temveč od
Izvedenih instrumentov in sodelovanja pri špekuliranju glavnih
strank (in svojem oddelku investicijskega bančništva).

Al (marsi)kdo ve nekaj kar mi ne vemo in pol prodajajo al pa njeno
delnico kdo napada, da bi jih kupil poceni.

Bol se bojim, da je prva opcija na kar kaže tudi zahteva po
dokapitalizaciji. Bo morala kar Švicarska država mošenjček odvezat,
pa NSB, če bo sploh dovolj, ker taka sistemska banka lahko nardi
zelo veliko luknjo.

author: crt

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Do sedanji kreditor Credit Suisse je bila Savdska arabija.
Ker se je Savdska arabija postavila na Rusko-Kitajsko stran je
prenehala likvidnostno zalagati Credit Suisse in ostale banke v ZDA
in EU.
Gre za bitko v vojni proti ameriški valuti.
author: FIN-263888

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Zadnja sprememba: crt 16.03.2023 08:33
sedez, regulator in lender of last resort za cs ni niti v zda niti
v eu, saudijci pa so nastopali v delniski, ne kreditni vlogi. glede
na to, da so nazadnje dokapitalizirali sele lani, jim ni za
zamerit, ce tokrat recejo "fak ze spet luknja, kaj ce bi poceli kaj
drugega". drugi mozni kupci so ze stali v cakalnici, pa se je snb
odlocila, da bi zaenkrat kot kaze ohranila "nacionalni ponos", such
as it is.

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Zadnja sprememba: 1127DXSXU 16.03.2023 09:58
[FIN-263888]
Do sedanji kreditor Credit Suisse je bila Savdska arabija.
Ker se je Savdska arabija postavila na Rusko-Kitajsko stran je
prenehala likvidnostno zalagati Credit Suisse in ostale banke v ZDA
in EU.
Gre za bitko v vojni proti ameriški valuti.
po mojem ti domišljija preveč laufa.

Gre se za zelo velik denar in tu ni več politike, oziroma brata, ki
bi po politični liniji koga zakladal in mu kril poslovne
napake.
Tale banka bo čist komot rabila takšno pomoč, ki bo presegala vso
pomoč Ukrajini.

A to misliš da bo kdo dal sam zato da bo dokazal, da ne drži s
Kitajci?
Saudijci imajo sicer še vedno v US tresuries preko 100mrd USD,
kolikor vidim pa ne šparajo več tolk kot so včasih, temveč imajo en
kup svojih državnih projektov...

V bistvu kot povedano že prej bodo svojo banko reševali Švicarji al
pa nihče.
author: 1127DXSXU

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Zakaj meniš da ni politike.
Ravno pri visokih zneskih se ta pokaže.
Za navadne vole bi take banke enostavno pustili propast.
V koncni fazi to najverjetneje bo, lahko pa tak proces traja še n
let.
Vmes pridejo kitajci, savdijci, nove tehnologije, mogoče celo
marsovci:).
Če savdijci delajo projekt utopicnega mesta in si zelijo zimskih
olimpijskih iger, veš da so zneski tu postranskega pomena.
author: hostamox

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
[hostamox]
Zakaj meniš da ni politike.
Ravno pri visokih zneskih se ta pokaže.
Za navadne vole bi take banke enostavno pustili propast.
V koncni fazi to najverjetneje bo, lahko pa tak proces traja še n
let.
Vmes pridejo kitajci, savdijci, nove tehnologije, mogoče celo
marsovci:).
Če savdijci delajo projekt utopicnega mesta in si zelijo zimskih
olimpijskih iger, veš da so zneski tu postranskega
pomena.

Če si Sauujci nekaj zazelijo seveda kupijo, pa cetudi stane
veliko.
Ampak tradicionalno problematicna švicarska banka ne spada med take
užitke.
Ni pa tu vmes po mojem geopolitike. Da zaradi tega ne bi
financirali 50mrd za to banko.
Arabci zdaj že nekaj let furajo svojo igro, dolarja ne uničujejo,
očitno pa ga ne bodo več financirali.
Svet se očitno vrača v stare kolesnice, ko zahod ni bil vse. To ni
nujno slabo.

author: hostamox

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
krneki. pred grki so bili egipcani, pred njimi sumerci, pa tko na
grobo cel kup mezopotamskih civilizacij, katerih zacetki segajo
6000 let nazaj. v srednjem veku so arabci peljali scat celo evropo,
ki je zivela v bajtah skupaj s prasici, oni so pa medtem postimali
znanost, ki jo je cerkev pri nas stlacila v greznico. zahod se je
postavil nazaj na noge sele s kolonizacijo tretjega sveta in
trgovino (predvsem atlantsko, s suznji).

author: crt

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Jep to je res.
Ampak podobno kot je religija bila omejitveni faktor v srednjem
veku v evropi, je ta lahko še vedno npr v indiji, bila na
kitajskem.
Če so bile velike civilizacije 6000let nazaj so imele kar nekaj
časa da narede letala npr.
Evropa je v samo 2000 letih kot praviš od prašičev prišla do
vesoljskih poletov.
Kitajci so že nevem kdaj risali zemljevide sveta npr.
Eno vprasanje je tudi ali je bilo krščanstvo sploh omejitveni
faktor, kolikor sem bral je bilo poganstvo v nasih krajih še v 17
stoletju, določeno obredje.

religija lahko v mnogocem deluje kot posredovanje "znanstvenih"

je po fiziologiji precej podobna cloveku in si vrsti delita veliko
parazitov in ce bos nepazljiv pri pripravi od zakola naprej do

namen zmislit neko preprosto razlago, ce ostanemo pri klanju:
halal, kosher,...
author: primvla

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Se pravi da religija tudi nekaj prinese in mogoče bi brez
krscanstva, otomani prisli vse do Pariza in Londona.
Kot sem ti dal link pri nas krscanstvo itak ni bilo močno.
Pa razvoj je prisel v te kraje z germani in njihovim
krscanstvom.
Ocena od oka.
Valvasor je pisal svojo slavo, ker o teh krajih ni bilo nič znanega
npr..
Pozabljeni, nepomebni za vse.
Saj ne da je danes kaj drugače :)
author: hostamox

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
[FjodorKirilovic]
> [1127DXSXU]
> Svet se očitno vrača v stare kolesnice, ko zahod ni bil vse.
To ni nujno slabo.

Kdaj zahod ni bil vse? Od Grkov naprej do danes je zahod
glavni.
Marsikdaj.

V bistvu smo glavni zadnjih 200 let, prej od nekje leta 1600 smo
bili v vzponu, pred tem pa nismo bili nikoli vodilni.

Še celo v času rimskega cesarstva je bilo še par drugih cesarstev,
ki so se lahko kosale z njegovo močjo (npr. na Kitajskem, srednjem
vzhodu, itd.)
POl pa so bili od propada rimskega cesrstva glavni razni drugi. Od
Arabcev, Mongolov.
naše šolstvo nas ne uči od drugih zato večinoma ne poznamo drugih
civilizacij kot Zahoda (tj.rimskega imperija), pa tudi knjižnice
drugih civilizacij so bile požgane (npr. V bagdadu 1258), zato
verjamemo da so bili Grki vse.

tule si malo preberi:


Approx. 4000 BCE: Urban life emerges in Sumer. Uruk is the
preeminent Sumerian city.

3000 BCE: Upper and Lower Egypt are unified, making Egypt the most
powerful state in the world.

2300 BCE: The Akkadian Empire has emerged as possibly the first
empire in history.

1500 BCE: Egypt is probably the strongest power at this
point.

1200 BCE: Still Egypt.

1000 BCE: With the Middle East in turmoil, the Western Zhou Dynasty
in China is probably the strongest power in the world.

700 BCE: The Neo-Assyrian Empire, centered in Mesopotamia, was
probably the strongest power in the world at this point.

500 BCE: At this point the Achaemenid Empire, originating from
modern-day Iran, is the strongest empire in the history of the
world.

200 BCE: The Han Dynasty, Mauryan Empire, Seleucid Empire, and
Roman Republic are the contenders. India probably has the largest
economy and population at this point, so I'll go with the Mauryan
Empire.

50 BCE: The Han Dynasty is probably slightly ahead of the Roman
Republic at this point.

100: Tough call between the Han Dynasty and Roman Empire.
Interestingly, they both covered 6.5 million square kilometers,
they both had a little less than 100 million people at their peak,
they both lasted a bit over four centuries (counting only the
Western Roman Empire), and they both ended because they outlived
their usefulness to their de jure vassals. I'll call it a draw
between the Han Dynasty and Rome. The Parthian Empire (Iran),
Kushan Empire (northern India), and Satavana dynasty (southern
India) all had solid empires.

300: The Jin, Roman, and Sassanid Empires are the contenders, but
the Sassanid Empire isn't quite as big as the other two. Both the
Jin and Roman Empires had their fair share of civil wars, but the
Romans are in better shape at this point.

450: The Gupta Dynasty and Eastern Roman Empire are the two main
contenders. I'll go with the Gupta Dynasty by a hair.

600: The Eastern Roman Empire, Sui Dynasty (which would shortly be
succeeded by the Tang Empire), and the Sassanid Empire are the
contenders. The Roman Empire is smaller than it was in 100, while
the ruling Chinese dynasty is about the same size, so I'll go with
the Sui Dynasty.

800: The Abbasid Caliphate is probably stronger than the Tang
Dynasty at this point.

1000: The contenders are probably the Roman Empire (aka the
Byzantine Empire), Song Dynasty, Ghaznavid Empire (centered in
Iran), the Chola Dynasty (southern India) and the Fatimid Caliphate
(centered in Egypt). At this point in time, Western Europe (among
other areas) was behind technologically and had a lower population
than other regions. With other areas splintered, and with another
100 years of dominance, I'll go with the Song Dynasty.

1250: The Mongol Empire is one of the largest in history.

1500: Spain, the Ottoman Empire, and the Ming Dynasty are the main
contenders. Spain was starting to build a vast colonial empire, and
would soon gain de facto control of Habsburg lands. The Ottoman
Empire would soon defeat the Mamluks and gain control of Egypt. But
in 1500, the vast economy and population of the Ming Dynasty made
it the most powerful country in the world.

1700: France under Louis XIV was probably the most powerful country
in Europe. Spain still had its vast colonial empire, but it had
weak ruler and was about to become (to some degree) a vassal state
of France. England had established control over the British isles
but had barely begun to put together their vast colonial empire.
However, despite the rise of colonialism and the Atlantic trade,
Europe still wasn't clearly the most powerful region in the world;
that separation would not come until the beginning of the
Industrial Revolution. The Ottoman Empire was still strong, and the
Qing Dynasty in China and the Mughal Empire in India looked strong
as well. The Qing Dynasty is probably the strongest country in the
world at this point, again based on population and economy.

1815: The Napoleonic Wars would end this year. At the same time,
the Industrial Revolution has started to elevate the power of
European countries above all others. France would be given more
lenient terms after the Napoleonic Wars than many had thought and
would remain a great power. Austria-Hungary and Russia both have
large empires, as does the Qing Dynasty. But the British, as the
center of the early Industrial Revolution, and as the owners of the
strongest navy in the world, are probably the strongest country in
the world at this point.

1914: The Europeans have a major technological advantage on all
others at this point. Russia, France, Austria-Hungary, and Italy
are all great powers, but they don't compare to the Germans,
British, and Americans, which have the three largest economies in
the world. The Americans don't have the military power or will to
exert the same influence as Germany and Britain. Germany has more
people in Germany itself and the better army, but Britain has a
larger empire and a better navy. Britain seems to have the
advantage based on having better diplomacy, as they would succeed
in recruiting the US, Italy, and Japan onto their side in World War
I. So I guess I'll go with Great Britain.

1919: At the end of World War I, most European countries have
suffered huge economic and population losses, while the US didn't
exert the same amount of effort. It still doesn't have a large
military, but it's economic advantage over other countries is too
great to say that any other country is more powerful. Great Britain
is the only country on the same level as the US at this
point.

1939: The US, Great Britain, and Germany are again the main
contenders, with each having familiar strengths (economy, navy, and
army, respectively). Again, I'd go with the US.

1942: Germany controls half of Europe, but is fighting a two-front
war. If the Nazis had succeeded in knocking either Britain or
Russia out of the war, then the Germans might have been first. But
luckily they didn't, so it's the US.

1945: The US, Soviet Union, and Great Britain are the contenders,
but the US is still the strongest country in the world.

2009: The US. No military or economy can compare.

ctx: Švicarska centralna banka bo reševala Credit Suisse
content:
Jep to je res.
Ampak saj veš, da iz majhnega raste veliko in ravno tu je po moje
evropa v prednosti.
Vsekakor ne po st. ljudi ali ekonomiji.
Kot si navedel zgoraj so bile kolonialne velesile zadnjih 500 let
spanija potlej Francija in kasneje anglija mogoče vmes še
nizozemska.
Te drzave skupaj so miši v primerjavi s kitajsko ali indijo. Ki sta
zgodovinsko gledano ekonomsko, prebivalstveno najmočnejši.
